thread.title: 16 of the Most METAL Album Covers of the '80s
thread.title_full: 16 of the Most METAL Album Covers of the '80s

author: Anonymous
title: 16 of the Most METAL Album Covers of the '80s
text:
58pm by Will Weldon 
The '80s and '90s were a wild time for music , man, and maybe the most insane of any genre was metal. Actually, scratch that "maybe" — it 100 percent was. Metal had a culture all its own, which these days seems absolutely bizarre. I mean, just get a load of these album covers… Pantera, Metal Magic 
Giant Cat + Swords + Looks Like It Was Spay Painted On The Side Of A Van Destruction, Release From Agony 
Hideous Monster Man + That Font + The Band And Album Names Could Be Interchangeable Holy Moses, The New Machine Of Liechtenstein 
Incredibly Pompous Title + Brazen HR Geiger "Inspiration" Cities, Annihilation Absolute 
Nonsensical Title + More Spray Painted Van Art + Band Members Resembling Stock Photo Of "Metal Band" Stryper, To Hell With The Devil 
Generic Metal Font + Christian Metal Band Yet Just As Obsessed With The Devil As Non-Christian Metal Band + "Devil" On Album Cover Who Looks Like He Could Be In The Band Mama’s Boys, Power And Passion 
Naked Women Draped In White Fabric + Knife + Generic Album Name (though the band name "Mama’s Boys" is awesome) Helloween, Keeper Of The Seven Keys 
Ludicrous Pun Band Name + Nonsensical Album Title + Generic "Fantasy" Art Manowar, Blow Your Speakers 
Lame Double Entendre + Scantily Clad Women + Band Members Totally Disinterested In Them + Smattering Of Melee Weapons Raven, The Pack Is Back 
Photo Shoot Clearly Costing $0 + Band Members Seemingly Uncommitted To Their Own Gimmick + Generic "Metal" (Literally) Font Aaronsrod, Illusion Kill 
Different Font For Each Word + Band’s Name Almost Illegible + Nonsensical Title Cinderella, Night Songs 
Band Members Seemingly Uncommitted To Their Own Gimmick + What The Hell Is A "Night Song"? + Generic Dark Alleyway Background Voivod, Killing Technology 
Band’s Name Is Illegible + Generic Techno-Horror + Looks Like It Was Drawn Very Quickly Liege Lord, Burn To My Touch 
Generic Fantasy Art + "Scantily" Clad Woman + Drawn By A Seven-Year-Old Metal Church, The Dark 
Generic Metal Font + Word "Metal" In Band Name + Stock Photo Of Spooky Front Door Dissection, The Somberlain 
OVERLOAD TOO MANY TO COUNT101011 
Which album covers do you hate on a deep and fundamental level? Let me know on Twitter
